1:
Now those who are younger than I have nothing but mockery for me—\q these young men whose fathers I would have refused to allow to work beside the dogs of my flock.
\q
2:
Indeed, the strength of their fathers' hands, how could it have helped me—\q men in whom the strength of their mature age had perished?
\q
3:
They were thin from poverty and hunger;\q they gnawed at the dry ground in the darkness of wilderness and desolation.


\q
4:
They plucked saltwort and bushes' leaves;\q the roots of the broom tree were their food.
\q
5:
They were driven out from among people\q who shouted after them as one would shout after a thief.
\q
6:
So they had to live in river valleys,\q in holes of the earth and of the rocks.


\q
7:
Among the bushes they brayed like donkeys\q and they gathered together under the nettles.
\q
8:
They were the sons of fools, indeed, sons of nameless people!\q They were driven out of the land with whips.
\m


\q
9:
But now, for their sons I have become their subject for a song of mockery;\q indeed, I am now a joke to them.
\q
10:
They abhor me and stand far off from me;\q they do not refrain from spitting in my face.
\q
11:
For God has unstrung the string to my bow and afflicted me,\q and those who taunt me cast off restraint before my face.


\q
12:
Upon my right hand rise the rabble;\q they drive me away and
\q pile up against me their siege mounds.
\q
13:
They destroy my path;\q they push forward disaster for me,
\q men who have no one to hold them back.


\q
14:
They come against me like an army through a wide hole in a city wall;\q in the midst of the destruction they roll themselves in on me.
\q
15:
Terrors are turned upon me;\q my honor is driven away as if by the wind;
\q my prosperity passes away as a cloud.
\m


\q
16:
Now my life is pouring out from within me;\q many days of suffering have laid hold on me.
\q
17:
In the night my bones in me are pierced;\q the pains that gnaw at me take no rest.


\q
18:
God's great force has seized my clothing;\q it wraps around me like the collar of my tunic.
\q
19:
He has thrown me into the mud;\q I have become like dust and ashes.


\q
20:
I cry to you, God, but you do not answer me;\q I stand up, and you merely look at me.
\q
21:
You have changed and become cruel to me;\q with the strength of your hand you persecute me.


\q
22:
You lift me up to the wind and cause it to drive me along;\q you throw me back and forth in a storm.
\f + \ft Some modern versions have \fqa you dissolve me in a storm \fqa* . \f*
\q
23:
For I know that you will bring me to death,\q to the house appointed for all the living.
\m


\q
24:
However, does no one reach out with his hand to beg for help when he falls?\q Does no one in trouble call out for help?
\q
25:
Did not I weep for him who was in trouble?\q Did I not grieve for the needy man?
\q
26:
When I hoped for good, then evil came;\q when I waited for light, darkness came instead.


\q
27:
My heart is troubled and does not rest;\q days of affliction have come on me.
\q
29:
I am a brother to jackals,\q a companion of ostriches.


\q
30:
My skin is black and falls away from me;\q my bones are burned with heat.
\q
31: Therefore my harp is tuned for songs of mourning,\q my flute for the singing of those who wail.
